content: Lifestyle Asked by AnonymousAsked on 13 Nov 2018I have a joint account with my mum (who is retired). Just today, I found out that has many transactions buying TOTO and 4D, and that she spends more than $500 every month on it. What should I do?Since it's her money, should I just let her continue? Or should I step in and talk to her about it?6 answersAnswerBump1

Benedict LimLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Tell her to buy toto and 4d from you. Assure her that if the numbers she buys comes out, you will pay her the same amount Singapore Pools will pay. If the numbers do not come out, you can save the money for her and use the money to pay her if she ever win. The chances of her winning.....is low anyways2 comments6

RookieAnswered on 20 Nov 2018It is unlikely that your mum (who is retired) would spend more then $500 every month on lottery and furthermore use NETS to pay for it from the joint account she has with you instead of paying via cash or non-joint account knowing thay you would eventually be aware ?She could had strike big amount before so there is this enthusiastism or perhaps it could just be shared stakes with others. You have to ask her to minimise her stakes if she is indeed staking so much alone but i would suggest to forego asking her to stop buying totally as it would not work as most probably she will switch to pay cash instead because to a punter, money won is twice as sweet as money earned !  :)0 comments1
